posts.text: Many reports show that a majority of the affidavits are more complaining than anything. I mean, they talk more about how people look or talk to them. The ones that are used commonly include hearsay, so are inadmissible. That’s why so many are thrown out. Although your point of people talking about the same thing does spark some questions.

I think I found an article covering it on “Politico, it didn’t give opinions, just showed the glitch and responses. Affidavits can be unsworn before being used in a court, so they aren’t lying until it’s being used as evidence and they say they were telling the truth in that court. The video I think your talking about, the governor, a republican, said that it was the normal tallying process
Even without Georgia, he still would’ve won btw. I acknowledge that some shifty stuff happened there, but it isn’t enough to nullify Biden’s inauguration
So many actual experts have analysed the election results, republican and democrat. When do you believe? When you get what you want?

The thing is we do have the facts, votes were recounted in places that trumped deemed necessary, and they still came out Democrat. I find it interesting though that you don’t want to look for republican fraud. Just saying.
